author: PRABIN KALITA
description: A 41-year-old report by the Tribhuvan Prasad Tewary Commission, recently made public by the Assam government, reveals that successive administrations allowed the state's "land and identity crisis" to worsen. The report, which investigated the 1983 Nellie massacre, identified illegal immigration and land disputes as key drivers of violence, not just communal clashes.
title: '1983 Nellie killings not communal': Assam makes Tewary report public; 41 years after submission

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: The Indian government will back the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority of India (AERA) in a Supreme Court battle against Delhi and Mumbai airport operators. The case concerns a Rs 50,000-crore claim for hypothetical regulatory asset base, which could lead to significant hikes in passenger charges if awarded to the operators.
title: ‘Govt steps in’: Centre backs flyers in SC fight; Delhi, Mumbai operators face Rs 50,000cr hit

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Toronto Maple Leafs coach Craig Berube faces uncertainty. Reports suggest John Tortorella and Pete DeBoer are being considered as replacements. The team's performance has led to speculation about a coaching change. Management has made no official announcement regarding Berube's future. The Maple Leafs recently secured a significant victory against the Pittsburgh Penguins.
title: Maple Leafs rumor: Team eyes John Tortorella as possible Berube replacement

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Valkyrae clarified a resurfaced August 2025 clip where she joked about buying a fellow streamer's "entire bloodline." She described the remark as a "lame rich joke" that didn't land as intended and was taken out of context. The streamer emphasized the playful nature of the exchange and her immediate realization of how the isolated comment sounded.
title: Valkyrae controversy: Streamer clarifies viral resurfaced joke about wealth

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: The Election Commission has extended the SIR Phase 2 timeline by a week across 12 states and UTs to ensure electoral roll transparency. This move follows reports of alleged malpractices, allowing booth level officers more time to share elector lists with political parties. The extended period aims to prevent errors and build trust before the final roll publication.
title: EC extends SIR deadline by a week, it's Dec 11 now

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Indian airlines IndiGo, Air India, and Air India Express successfully reverted flight-control software on 323 Airbus A320 jets to a safer 2022 version. This rapid rollback averted widespread groundings after Airbus identified a potential loss of control issue during intense solar storms. Carriers experienced minimal disruption, with only minor cancellations and delays.
title: India's A320 fleet finishes software fix in just over a day

author: TNN
description: A national-level bodybuilder and para-athlete from Rohtak, Rohit Dhankhar, died after being attacked for confronting men harassing women at a wedding. Dhankhar was severely beaten by a group of nearly 20 armed assailants after the wedding ceremony. His family alleges it was a planned murder for standing up for women's dignity.
title: Para-athlete attacked for taking on group harassing women dies

author: TNN
description: An exemptee assistant sub inspector, Sushil Kumar, has been charged in a bribery case linked to former Rohtak IGP Y Puran Kumar. Sushil allegedly demanded money from individuals involved in disputes, using the IGP's name. Digital evidence, including call records and transaction clues, supports the allegations.
title: Police file chargesheet against Puran Kumar’s aide in bribery case

author: TNN
description: New government orders mandate communication apps like WhatsApp and Telegram to enforce stricter login protocols.  Users will face automatic logouts from desktop versions every six hours, requiring QR code re-authentication.  Smartphone access will also be restricted to the original SIM card used for registration, aiming to curb cyber fraud and enhance security.
title: ‘To curb cyber fraud’: Govt tightens app security; WhatsApp, Telegram to enforce SIM link

author: TNN
description: The government plans to introduce a new cess on tobacco and pan masala products. This move aims to prevent price drops after the GST compensation cess is phased out, ensuring these 'sin goods' remain costly. The proposed health and security cess will be implemented once notified, potentially before the compensation cess expires in March 2026.
title: FM to move bill today for new cess on tobacco, pan masala

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: Houston Rockets' star Kevin Durant is back for their November 30th game against the Utah Jazz after a personal absence.  Despite other key players sidelined, Durant's return bolsters a strong Rockets team aiming to maintain their Western Conference lead.  His presence is expected to significantly impact Houston's offense against a struggling Jazz squad.
title: Kevin Durant injury update: Will Rockets star play tonight vs Jazz?

author: TNN
description: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped for 12 days in Hapur, UP, after her friend drugged her. The survivor escaped and reported the ordeal, leading to the registration of an FIR under various sections, including POCSO. Two arrests have been made, while the friend and his father remain at large.
title: Meerut: Teen’s drink spiked by friend; his dad, 2 others rape her

author: SHARIQ MAJEED
description: A woman has been sentenced to life imprisonment for poisoning and murdering an NRI man and burying his body. The victim, Raminder Singh Cheema, was lured to a rented house in Jalandhar, drugged, and robbed before being killed. His body was then buried to conceal the crime.
title: Facebook friendship turns deadly: Woman jailed for NRI’s murder; motive linked to property

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: Philadelphia 76ers' star Joel Embiid is questionable for tonight's game against the Atlanta Hawks due to ongoing right knee management.  Having missed nine games, his availability hinges on pain management and on-court participation.  The Sixers, already battling other injuries, face a crucial test of depth as they aim for a win.
title: Is Joel Embiid playing vs Hawks? Latest injury update

author: AMISHA PANDEY
description: Golden State Warriors star Klay Thompson has renamed his boat 'SS Stallion' in a public tribute to his girlfriend, rapper Megan Thee Stallion. This affectionate gesture, shared on Instagram, highlights their comfortable and confident romance. Fans are embracing the public display of commitment, seeing it as a natural progression for the couple who have been openly dating for months.
title: Klay Thompson names his boat 'SS Stallion' after Megan Thee Stallion; fans react

author: TNN
description: Delhi Police busted a terror-gangster module run by Pakistan-based Shehzad Bhatti, allegedly planning to target Lawrence Bishnoi's brother. Three youths, Asif, Hargunpreet Singh, and Vikas Prajapati, were arrested for executing grenade attacks in Punjab. Bhatti lured them with money and remotely coordinated operations, using social media to recruit disposable foot soldiers for public place attacks.
title: ‘Pakistan module busted’: Three held in Delhi; plot to target Anmol Bishnoi uncovered

author: TNN
description: Two Gujarati men based in Chicago suburbs face felony charges for allegedly defrauding an elderly woman in North Kenosha of over $653,000 in gold. Prosecutors state this is part of an international scam where the victim was tricked into believing her savings were compromised. The accused are charged with money laundering and theft, with evidence suggesting overseas coordination.
title: Two Gujaratis charged in $653,000 US gold bar scam

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: ‘Gunmen opened fire after blast’: FC HQ in Pakistan targeted again; three killed

author: NASEER GANAI
description: The National Conference (NC) has reaffirmed its commitment to restoring Jammu and Kashmir's special status under Article 370 through a recent working committee resolution. This move aims to counter claims of the party abandoning a core issue and aligning with the BJP. NC also urged the Centre to restore full statehood to J&K as promised.
title: NC puts spotlight back on special status, counters ‘pro-BJP’ talk

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Dallas Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg etched his name in NBA history, becoming the youngest player to score 35 points in a game against the Los Angeles Clippers.  Flagg's impressive performance, which included 11 assists, saw him surpass LeBron James' previous record by five days. Coach Jason Kidd lauded Flagg's all-around game and composure.
title: Cooper Flagg surpasses LeBron as Mavericks rookie sets rare NBA record

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: December marks a vibrant end to the year in India with national commemorations like Vijay Diwas and Kisan Diwas, alongside widespread Christmas celebrations. Regional festivals and tribal events highlight the nation's rich diversity. Globally, the month emphasizes crucial awareness campaigns on health, human rights, and environmental sustainability, fostering a spirit of collective responsibility.
title: Important days in Dec : National and international dates to note for holidays, observances – details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Elon Musk revealed his partner, Shivon Zilis, is of Indian descent, with one of their sons' middle names being Sekhar in tribute to physicist Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. Zilis, who grew up in Canada after being adopted, is a key figure at Neuralink. Musk also commented on the changing landscape for Indian talent in America due to visa policies.
title: 'My partner is half-Indian': Musk reveals on Nikhil Kamath podcast — 'son’s middle name is Sekhar'

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Seth Curry is rejoining the Golden State Warriors for the remainder of the 2025-26 NBA season, fulfilling the dream of playing alongside his brother Stephen. Initially waived due to financial restrictions, Seth was recently signed to a one-year deal, marking his first time sharing an NBA court with Stephen after 12 seasons and nine previous teams.
title: Seth Curry returns to Warriors on 1-year deal, sparking reunion buzz with Steph

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli's magnificent 135 powered India to a 17-run victory over South Africa in the first ODI. His 52nd ODI century, a record in a single format, alongside Rohit Sharma's 57, set a strong foundation. Despite a late South African surge, Kuldeep Yadav's crucial wickets secured the win, giving India a 1-0 series lead.
title: 'I'm 37 and need time for recovery': What Kohli said after India's win

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli's magnificent 52nd ODI century powered India to a 17-run victory over South Africa in the first ODI. Kuldeep Yadav's crucial wickets and Harshit Rana's early burst secured India's 1-0 series lead. Kohli's stellar 135 set up a formidable 349, with Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul also contributing significantly.
title: IND vs SA: Kohli's hundred, Kuldeep four-for power India’s 17-run win in first ODI

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has dismissed rumours of approaching Virat Kohli to reverse his Test retirement, stating no such conversation has occurred. These speculations arose amid India's recent Test struggles. Meanwhile, Kohli's century powered India to a 17-run ODI victory over South Africa, with Kuldeep Yadav and Harshit Rana also impressing with the ball.
title: Kohli to reverse Test retirement? BCCI Secretary breaks silence

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Elon Musk discussed US trade policies and the H-1B visa system with Nikhil Kamath, expressing his opposition to aggressive tariffs and advocating for free trade. Musk also boldly predicted that advancements in AI and robotics will make working optional within 10-15 years, leading to a world of near-limitless abundance.
title: Musk didn’t want Trump to impose tariffs? Here's what Tesla CEO said

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Indian stock markets will observe a holiday on Thursday, December 25, for Christmas, with trading resuming on Friday, December 26. This marks the only major scheduled market closure in December, making it a relatively quiet month for trading. The last trading session in November concluded flat for both the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty.
title: Stock market holidays in December: Check details for NSE, BSE

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: An Indian-origin student, identified as Vijay Kumar Sheoran from Haryana, was fatally stabbed in a street attack in Worcester, central England. Police have arrested five men on suspicion of murder, who have since been released on bail pending further investigation. Authorities are appealing for witnesses to the incident.
title: ‘Tragic death’: Indian-origin student from Haryana fatally stabbed in UK; probe under way

author: MAHIMA ROY
description: Despite an average season with four losses in eleven games, the Los Angeles Chargers' star quarterback Justin Herbert is set to play against the Las Vegas Raiders. Herbert, who recently recovered from an ankle injury, is deemed fully fit by the team. Head coach Jim Harbaugh praised Herbert as one of the best quarterbacks of all time.
title: Will Justin Herbert play today? Latest injury update on Chargers star QB

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Sri Lanka is facing a severe crisis as Cyclone Ditwah has caused devastating floods and landslides, resulting in at least 334 deaths and nearly 400 people missing. Over a million individuals are affected, with low-lying areas in Colombo still inundated. India has dispatched an additional 10 tons of disaster response aid, including a medical team, to assist the nation.
title: Cyclone Ditwah: Toll climbs to 334 in Sri Lanka; India steps up relief ops

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his disapproval of South Africa coach Shukri Conrad's remark during the recent Test series. Gavaskar pointed out India's significant role in South Africa's cricket return and current investments through the SA20 league. He suggested Conrad acknowledge his comment, emphasising the strong, collaborative bond between Indian and South African cricket over the years.
title: 'I don't believe in apologies': Gavaskar slams SA coach for 'grovel' remark

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Parliament's Winter Session kicks off with a robust economic agenda, featuring nine key bills. Reforms include a 100% FDI cap for insurance, new taxation for tobacco and pan masala, and a consolidated Securities Markets Code.  The session also aims to decriminalize minor offenses and update corporate laws, promising significant legislative action.
title: Parl winter session's economic agenda: 9 bills listed; sin-goods taxation & more in focus

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli has etched his name in history, smashing his 52nd ODI century to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record. This monumental achievement, witnessed in Ranchi against South Africa, solidifies Kohli's status as an ODI batting titan.  Even amidst retirement calls, his stellar 135-run knock, alongside contributions from Sharma and Rahul, propelled India to a formidable 350.
title: 'Ponting also rated him as GOAT': Gavaskar as Kohli surpasses Tendulkar

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Elon Musk, speaking on a podcast, acknowledged the benefits of skilled Indian immigrants to the US via the H-1B visa program. However, he also pointed out instances of misuse by some companies seeking to cut costs, advocating for an end to "gaming the system" rather than shutting down the program entirely.
title: 'US benefitted immensely': Musk on H-1B row; praises skilled Indians

author: JAYANTA KALITA AND RAJESH SHARMA
description: Codenamed ‘Madeleine,’ she was known in French Resistance circles as a mysterious figure who seemed to appear and vanish like smoke. France recently honoured her with a commemorative postage stamp for her crucial role in the fight against the Nazi regime
title: Noor Inayat Khan: How this Indian-origin spy gave the Nazis a tough time

author: NATASHA BOSE
description: Aaron Rodgers is expected to start for the Pittsburgh Steelers in Week 13 despite suffering at least three fractures in his left wrist. The veteran quarterback returned to full practice before the matchup against the Buffalo Bills and carries no injury designation. His ability to play has major implications for Pittsburgh’s AFC North race and the Steelers’ playoff push.
title: Aaron Rodgers’ status vs Bills: Shock injury twist reveals plan despite fractures

author: MAHIMA ROY
description: Despite a poor season for the New York Jets, star running back Breece Hall is set to play against the Atlanta Falcons. Hall, who has overcome serious past injuries, was reportedly a trade target but is now fully fit and focused on the current season. The Jets are looking for a win at MetLife Stadium.
title: Breece Hall injury update: Jets RB’s status vs Falcons revealed today

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: An Afghan national, formerly with US military and CIA-backed units, was arrested for a daylight shooting in Washington D.C. The incident led the Trump administration to pause asylum decisions and suspend visas for Afghan nationals. The suspect allegedly served in a "Zero Unit" known for high-risk missions.
title: 'Death squad': DC shooter linked to Afghanistan's elite 'Zero Unit' - What is it?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Turkey's Bayraktar Kızılelma, an uncrewed fighter jet, has achieved a historic milestone by successfully shooting down a jet-powered aircraft using a beyond-visual-range missile during trials. This marks the first time an unmanned aerial vehicle has demonstrated such air-to-air combat capability, utilizing domestically developed radar and missile technology. The advanced UAV also conducted joint flights with F-16s.
title: 'Global first': Turkey's drone shoots down aircraft with air-to-air missile - watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Honduras voted Sunday with US aid hanging in the balance, as President Trump backed right-wing candidate Nasry Asfura against incumbent leftist Xiomara Castro.  Polls showed a tight race, with Rixi Moncada and Salvador Nasralla also vying for the presidency. Trump's threats to cut aid if Asfura lost, coupled with his pledge to pardon a former Honduran president facing drug charges, added significant international pressure to the election.
title: Honduras presidential race: Country sees potential right shift; Trump makes aid threats

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Despite Operation Sindoor destroying several terrorist launching pads across the LoC, the BSF reports that some remain active, with Pakistan attempting to infiltrate terrorists ahead of winter. These shifting launchpads, now located in "depth areas" away from the border, are reportedly used for pushing terrorists into India, with groups now mixed.
title: 'Op Sindoor not over': BSF says terror launchpads active; on alert for infiltration bids

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: India's Union government mandates SIM card verification and six-hour session timeouts for messaging apps to combat cyber fraud. Platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram must ensure continuous SIM linkage, blocking access if the original SIM is absent. This directive aims to enhance telecom cybersecurity by preventing misuse from outside the country.
title: Big govt order: WA, Telegram told to link services to SIM cards; what it means for users

author: NATASHA SINGH
title: Clean homes, dirty streets: Two faces of our civic sense

author: KANCHAN YADAV
description: India's currency is facing a sharp decline in 2025. What are the top reasons behind? Is it the trade disputes with the US or the reduced foreign investment or the Reserve Bank of India's managing of the situation with a restrained approach. What is making the rupee's value fall significantly this year?
title: Explained: How India's Rupee ended up as Asia's worst currency this year

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: British Airways is significantly boosting its India operations, adding a third daily flight to Delhi next year. Citing "incredible potential" and strong outbound travel demand, the airline sees India as its second-largest market. This expansion includes local hiring and a robust contact center, underscoring a commitment to the growing Indian aviation sector.
title: ‘Incredible potential’: British Airways eyeing expansion in India, says COO

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Andre Russell has retired from the Indian Premier League. Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan shared a tribute. Russell will now serve as KKR's power coach. He had a significant career with the team. KKR aims for a better season and has a large purse for the upcoming auction.
title: Russell's retirement: SRK quips - 'Any other jersey would look weird on you'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Two Booth Level Officers died in Uttar Pradesh amid the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of poll rolls. Sarvesh Singh died by suicide, citing work pressure. Shobharani died of cardiac arrest after working late. The Election Commission has extended the revision schedule by one week. These incidents highlight the strain on BLOs across several states.
title: ‘Unable to cope’: Two BLOs die in UP; one by suicide, another from cardiac arrest

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A 4.4-magnitude earthquake jolted Nepal's Bajhang district in Sudur Paschim province on Sunday afternoon. The tremors, originating from the Saipal mountain region, were also felt in nearby western districts. No immediate reports of damage or casualties have been issued.
title: Earthquake: 4.4-magnitude quake hits Nepal’s Bajhang; no damages reported

author: AHAMED ALI
title: Govt bus collide head-on; 11 killed, 20 injured in collision near Karaikudi

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A teenage girl in Nanded performed symbolic wedding rituals with her murdered boyfriend's body after her father and brothers were arrested for his killing over their inter-caste relationship. The girl, Aanchal, stated her family opposed their union due to caste differences and vowed to live with her deceased lover's mother.
title: ‘Immortal love’: Teen marries boyfriend’s corpse; family booked for caste killing

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli's record-breaking 52nd ODI century powered India to 349/8 against South Africa. The star batsman's 135, supported by Rohit Sharma's 57 and KL Rahul's 60, formed the backbone of the innings. However, the standout moment after the veteran's ton came when a pitch invader briefly interrupted the celebrations but was quickly removed by officials.
title: IND vs SA: Fan breaches security and falls at Virat Kohli's feet - Watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Indonesia's death toll from severe floods and landslides has reached 442, with hundreds missing and injured, as two cities on Sumatra remain unreachable. Thailand is also grappling with devastating floods, having claimed 162 lives, while Malaysia continues to shelter thousands displaced by the monsoon. Climate change is cited as a factor intensifying these deadly weather events.
title: Indonesia floods: Toll rises to 442, hundreds missing; warships deployed for rescue ops

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Tamil Nadu: Two buses collide head-on; at least 11 dead

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Zerodha CEO Nikhil Kamath's teaser for his upcoming podcast featuring Elon Musk has gone viral, sparking speculation about its authenticity. Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, has assessed the video as likely AI-generated, fueling debate about whether it's a marketing stunt amidst a rise in AI-generated content.
title: AI or real: Nikhil Kamath's meeting with Elon Musk: What Grok says

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Banks nationwide will observe several holidays in December 2025, in addition to regular weekend closures. These closures, dictated by the RBI's festive and regional holiday calendar, will impact in-branch services. Online banking and UPI will remain operational throughout these observances.
title: Bank holidays in December 2025: Check complete state-wise list

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally requested a presidential pardon while his corruption trial is ongoing. President Isaac Herzog's office acknowledged the "extraordinary request" and stated it would be considered responsibly after reviewing all relevant opinions. The plea follows an appeal from US President Donald Trump.
title: Bibi’s corruption trial: Israeli PM seeks pardon; Prez calls request ‘extraordinary’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Delhi: Police busts Pak-backed gangster-turned-terror module; nabs three terrorists

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Public anger over Hong Kong's deadliest fire has led to protests demanding accountability. Student activist Miles Kwan, who called for an independent investigation, was reportedly detained under the national security law. Authorities accused "anti-China forces" of exploiting the tragedy, while activists argue the inferno was a preventable disaster.
title: Hong Kong fire: Anger over 146 deaths spills on to streets; China slaps sedition law

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli showcased his class with a masterful century, anchoring India's innings to 233/4 in 38 overs against South Africa. His brilliant 103 off 102 balls, featuring six fours and five sixes, was complemented by a crucial 136-run partnership with Rohit Sharma. Kohli's composed knock ensured India remained on track for a substantial total.
title: IND vs SA: Kohli punches air, roars with another ODI hundred

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli achieved a historic milestone with his 52nd ODI century against South Africa. He now holds the record for most centuries in a single international format. Kohli's masterful innings provided India with a strong foundation. He displayed remarkable control and strokeplay on a challenging pitch. The crowd celebrated his achievement with a standing ovation.
title: IND vs SA: Tendulkar surpassed! Kohli becomes only cricketer to earn this record

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan has expressed her strong disapproval of paparazzi. She stated her relationship with them is zero, contrasting it with her respect for the media. Bachchan finds their intrusive behaviour unacceptable. She also mentioned she does not care about social media opinions. The actress recently refused to pose for photographers at an event.
title: Jaya Bachchan says she doesn’t care about being the ‘most hated person’ on social media

author: ARVIND CHAUHAN
description: A woman, Arti Yadav, wife of a Navy officer, died after allegedly being pushed from a train by a TTE in Etawah. She had boarded the wrong train due to a delay. Witnesses claim the TTE threw her luggage and pushed her. Her father alleges murder, while police are investigating, considering the possibility she jumped.
title: 'Pushed her off train': Navy officer’s wife found dead on rly tracks; TTE booked

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishq Mein' has garnered significant praise and a strong box office performance. The film opened to ₹16 crore on Day 1 and maintained a steady pace, collecting ₹17 crore on Day 2, reaching a total of ₹33 crore. It continued its successful run on Sunday, adding ₹6.82 crore to reach ₹39.
title: Tere Ishq Mein Box Office Day 3: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon Film Hits Rs 39.82 Cr

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Balochistan province witnessed a wave of at least seven explosions in 24 hours, with insurgents targeting Quetta and Dera Murad Jamali. While no fatalities were reported, two security guards were injured. Attacks included grenade assaults on police checkpoints and an IED blast disrupting rail services, fueling fear across the region.
title: 7 blasts in 24 hrs: Insurgents target trains, police; fear spreads in Pak's Balochistan

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Users attempting to access Perplexity's AI chatbot in India are being redirected to rival Google Gemini, as the company apparently neglected to register its country-specific domain. This move, while surprising given Perplexity's competition with Google, aligns with their global strategy of using Perplexity.ai. Despite this, Perplexity is actively expanding in India through partnerships with Airtel and Reliance Jio.
title: AI rivalry: Perplexity opens Google Gemini; no country-specific domain found

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma's impressive 57-run knock in the first ODI against South Africa was cut short by an LBW decision, which he chose not to review after consulting Virat Kohli. Despite the dismissal, Rohit etched his name in ODI history, surpassing Shahid Afridi's record for most sixes with his 352nd maximum. He also registered his 60th ODI half-century.
title: Kohli says no, Rohit walks: DRS moment steals spotlight

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Election Commission of India has criticized the West Bengal government for delaying increased honorariums for booth level officers (BLOs) and payments for the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. This comes as the TMC delegation accused the ECI of having "blood on their hands" over the revision process.
title: SIR row: ECI pulls up TMC govt for withholding BLO honorarium, says ‘very strange’

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Unbridled power for Munir: UN raises red flag; Pak acts indignant

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A woman married into a Delhi industrialist family was found dead, with an FIR detailing years of alleged abuse and intimidation. Her mother seeks a CBI inquiry after the woman's death, which followed a confrontation over her husband's alleged affair and subsequent mistreatment. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide.
title: 'Don't speak of it': Secrecy, strain before bizman's Bahu death; kin seek CBI probe

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 has launched with a Hollywood-themed Battle Pass, featuring iconic skins like Marty McFly and The Bride. Players can unlock these and other new characters, along with V-Bucks and cosmetic items, through a flexible progression system. The pass, costing 1,000 V-Bucks, offers over 100 rewards, encouraging players to explore different game modes for bonus unlocks.
title: Fortnite Chapter 7 skins: Full list and fastest ways to unlock them

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma became the leading six-hitter in ODI history, surpassing Shahid Afridi with his 352nd six. He also registered his 60th ODI half-century. Alongside Virat Kohli, they achieved their 20th century partnership, further solidifying India's strong batting performance.
title: History rewritten! Rohit smashes past Afridi to become leading six-hitter in ODIs

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI's partners are shouldering nearly $100 billion in debt linked to the AI firm, with SoftBank, Oracle, and CoreWeave borrowing heavily. This strategy leverages others' balance sheets, as OpenAI itself holds minimal debt. Oracle faces the largest exposure, with its stock value significantly impacted by these arrangements.
title: OpenAI under pressure: Company losses mount; partners under $100 billion in debt

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Ahead of Parliament's Winter Session, an all-party meeting saw the Opposition demanding detailed discussions on national security, the "SIR" issue, pollution, farmers' concerns, and democracy. They expressed worries about the government's handling of key national matters and insisted on parliamentary debates. The government stated its readiness to listen to the Opposition's concerns during the session.
title: Parliament Winter Session: Oppn seeks debate on Delhi blast, SIR; govt ready to listen

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India received 5.4 million tonnes of Russian oil worth 2.1 billion euros via 30 vessels operating under false flags between January and September 2025, a report reveals. This highlights Russia's use of a growing 'shadow fleet' to bypass Western sanctions, with India being a major recipient of these oil shipments.
title: 'Shadow fleet': India imported 5.4m tonnes of Russian oil; how Moscow dodged curbs

author: GAURAV GUPTA
description: Former chief selector Sandeep Patil strongly backs under-fire coach Gautam Gambhir, citing the complexities of the job and a lack of understanding from critics. Patil emphasized that pointing fingers at one person is unfair, especially when many critics haven't experienced coaching India themselves. He urged patience, highlighting that even successful coaches faced initial struggles, and Gambhir needs time to settle.
title: Stop blaming Gambhir alone for India’s Test defeats: Former chief selector

author: MANYA JAIN
description: A pervasive uniform aesthetic in consumer culture reflects a decline in individuality, driven by insecurity and the desire to belong. Brands and creators exploit this by selling ready-made identities, leading to overconsumption and environmental strain. This trend prioritises perception over utility, turning curated identities into disposable consumption.
title: Wait… do I really need that bag, or is Instagram gaslighting me again?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, Indian Chetak helicopters deployed from INS Vikrant conducted search and rescue missions in Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah. India has reaffirmed its solidarity, delivering 27 tonnes of relief material and standing by Sri Lanka through its Neighbourhood First policy.
title: Watch: IAF choppers rescue civilians in flood-hit Sri Lanka; C-130 joins relief ops

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Kolkata Knight Riders' explosive all-rounder Andre Russell is retiring from the IPL after a decade, transitioning to a "Power Coach" role for KKR from 2026. The 37-year-old cited a desire to leave a legacy and expressed deep attachment to the franchise. Russell's monumental IPL career includes two titles and numerous accolades, cementing his iconic status.
title: IPL: Andre Russell retires - Returns to KKR in new role

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Cyclone Ditwah has prompted a high alert in South India, with Tamil Nadu and Puducherry bracing for potential rain and thunderstorms. The cyclone's path runs parallel to the coast, posing a threat after claiming 159 lives in Sri Lanka. India has launched Operation Sagar Bandhu, deploying relief and rescue teams to assist the island nation.
title: Cyclone Ditwah: India on high alert as 3 die in TN; death toll in Sri Lanka crosses 150

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: SIR Phase 2 exercise: EC announces revised schedule for 12 states/UTs — check new dates

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Abhishek Sharma unleashed a record-shattering century for Punjab against Bengal, scoring 148 off just 52 balls. His explosive innings included 16 sixes, breaking his own record for most T20 sixes in a calendar year. This remarkable performance propelled Punjab past 300 runs, marking a historic achievement for the team.
title: Abhishek Sharma goes berserk: Shatters multiple T20 records

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Veteran Kannada actor Umesh, celebrated for his comedic talent and over 350 films, passed away at 80 after battling stage-four liver cancer. Known for his expressive humor and trademark dialogue delivery, Umesh's career spanned five decades, beginning with 'Makkala Rajya' in 1960. His final days were marked by remarkable optimism, even while bedridden.
title: Actor Umesh passes away at 80; Kannada cinema loses a beloved comic legend

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar asserted unity with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, dismissing speculation about power-sharing disagreements. Following a meeting, Shivakumar emphasized their commitment to governance and future electoral goals, aiming for a repeat victory in 2028.  Both leaders presented a united front, attributing rumors to media and opposition.
title: 'Know my limits': DKS says ‘no difference between me & CM' — Inside Karnataka's GoT

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi says November brought many inspirations

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A viral video of a littered Amsterdam street sparked debate on civic sense, with some users defending the city's overall cleanliness and blaming tourists for the mess. Despite the clip, global rankings indicate the Netherlands excels in environmental standards, with Amsterdam noted for its good air quality.
title: 'Who lacks civic sense?': Indian man films littered Amsterdam street - video

author: SEHJAL GUPTA
description: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.
title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership

author: AYANTIKA PAL
description: A family in Noida faced a heart-wrenching ordeal when their five-year-old son required surgery for alarming respiratory issues brought on by pollution after relocating to the area. Struggling with relentless allergies and breathing troubles that defied treatment, the little boy's condition worsened to include swollen tonsils and adenoids.
title: 5-year-old boy’s tonsils removed, mom blames Delhi-NCR pollution

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Tragedy struck a family gathering in Stockton as a shooting inside a banquet hall claimed four lives and injured ten others, including children. Sheriff's officials indicated the incident may have been targeted, with detectives actively investigating the motive. Several victims were transported to hospitals following the devastating event.
title: California shooting: 4 dead, several hurt at family gathering in Stockton

author: ABHAY
description: A tragic accident on Nelson Mandela Marg in Delhi claimed the life of a 23-year-old man and injured two others when a speeding Mercedes G63 crashed into them at an auto stand. The SUV reportedly lost control near a road diversion early Sunday. Police have arrested the 29-year-old driver, who was returning from a wedding. Investigations are ongoing.
title: Delhi car crash: Mercedes hits 3 near Vasant Kunj's Ambience mall; one dead, driver detained

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nikhil Kamath, co-founder of Zerodha, has unveiled a second teaser for his upcoming podcast featuring Elon Musk. The clip reveals a candid conversation about Musk's physique, his fascination with the letter 'X', and a humorous 'Matrix' character choice. This follows a silent teaser, hinting at a deep dive into success and perseverance with the tech mogul.
title: Elon Musk says ‘Honestly, sometimes I wonder….’ in Nikhil Kamath’s podcast

author: TOI Education
description: CBSE mandates skill education for Classes 6-8 from 2025-26, integrating hands-on learning in three work domains. This reform aims to reduce rote learning and expose students to real-life skills, but concerns about infrastructure, academic overload, and equitable implementation persist. The initiative requires schools to allocate dedicated hours, train teachers, and develop labs.
title: Explained: How CBSE’s new skill based learning framework will reshape classes 6 to 8

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma is on the verge of becoming the ODI sixes king, needing just three more to surpass Shahid Afridi's record of 351. He is also close to achieving 20,000 international runs, joining an elite group of Indian batsmen. Returning to ODI action against South Africa, Sharma carries significant responsibility to lead India's resurgence.
title: History incoming? Rohit Sharma just steps away from a career-defining feat

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Over 300 migrants have died in Malaysian custody since 2020, raising concerns about detention conditions and treatment. Recent cases, like that of Ben Za Min from Myanmar, highlight alleged medical neglect. Authorities have intensified raids and declared 2025 a "year of enforcement" amid rising illegal entries.
title: Malaysia: Over 300 migrants died since 2020; raids intensify on illegal immigrants

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A catastrophic event has shaken the community at Lake Maï-Ndombe, where a boat capsized, tragically taking the lives of at least 20 people, with others still feared missing. The incident occurred Thursday night when the vessel, overloaded and lacking proper safety equipment, sank, claiming victims including a local Catholic deacon.
title: Congo disaster: Boat capsizes on Lake Mai-Ndombe due to violent winds; 20 dead

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Maulana Mahmood Madani has ignited controversy with his remarks on the Supreme Court's handling of key cases and his views on 'jihad' and 'ghar wapsi'. His statements have drawn sharp criticism from the BJP and differing opinions within the Muslim community, highlighting a divided political landscape.
title: From SC to 'jihad' & 'ghar wapsi': Maulana Madani's controversial remarks — who is he?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A horrifying incident unfolded at 'La Resaka' bar in Tula, Mexico, where a deadly shooting has tragically taken the lives of seven patrons and critically injured five more. This ambush by armed attackers in the early hours appears to be tied to an escalating turf war fueled by gang rivalry over illegal activities like drug trafficking and fuel theft.
title: Gunmen open fire at bar in central Mexico; seven killed, five critically injured

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Rapido denies involvement in an Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe into a bike taxi driver's account, which allegedly received Rs 331 crore in illicit funds. The ED is investigating the "mule" account as part of a money-laundering case linked to online betting, with funds reportedly used for a lavish wedding.
title: ‘His actions personal’: Rapido denies role in Rs 331-crore deposits linked to driver

author: TNN
description: An industrialist's daughter-in-law allegedly faced prolonged mental and physical abuse, isolation, and humiliation at her marital home. Her mother has requested a CBI probe, citing incidents of assault during pregnancy, discovery of an extramarital affair, and restricted phone access, culminating in her death.
title: Industrialist’s bahu 'suicide' in south Delhi: Victim was dragged, assaulted when pregnant

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Fears for former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's life are mounting as his family, lawyers, and aides are denied access for weeks. His son publicly demanded proof of life, citing solitary confinement and ignored court orders. Jail rules grant superintendents broad discretion, allowing meetings and calls based on 'good behaviour,' but critics allege deliberate isolation.
title: Pakistan: Can Imran Khan meet visitors in jail? What rules say on 'political prisoner' access

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: With reduced game time, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are intensely focused on fitness and form, targeting the 2027 ODI World Cup. Despite lack of assured public words from chief selector Ajit Agarkar and coach Gautam Gambhir, their dedication and recent performances suggest a strong desire to continue playing.
title: The RoKo reboot: Focus readjusted, 2027 ODI World Cup target locked

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump is invoking a law to halt migration from "third-world countries," citing national security. This move, despite UN appeals, includes pausing asylum decisions and visa issuance for Afghan nationals. The administration cites public safety following a recent shooting incident involving an Afghan national as justification for these stringent measures.
title: Trump justifies 'third world' migration ban amid asylum appeals; cites law

author: AP
title: US university to pay Trump admin $75m to restore $790 million aid

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: NASA's James Webb Telescope has unveiled stunning new details of the Red Spider Nebula, NGC 6537.  The image reveals the nebula's central star, previously faint, now glowing red due to hot dust.  Scientists are also seeing the full extent of the nebula's 'legs' and a fast-moving jet carving its intricate structure, offering fresh insights into stellar death.
title: ‘Cosmic Creepy-Crawly’: Nasa unveils new Red Spider Nebula image; reveals new details

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Cyclone Ditwah intensifies, prompting a red alert for northern Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and south Andhra Pradesh. Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall is anticipated in several districts. Authorities urge residents to stay indoors and fishermen to avoid the sea. Air India warns of flight disruptions. Sri Lanka has already reported significant destruction and casualties.
title: Cyclone Ditwah: IMD issues red alert for north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry; top 10 developments

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal's wedding on November 23 was postponed. This happened after Mandhana's father and Muchhal fell ill. Both have been discharged from the hospital. Team India player Jemimah Rodrigues withdrew from WBBL to support Mandhana. Families remain optimistic about a future wedding date.
title: Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal update their Insta bio after wedding postponed

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Team India's training session saw Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma preparing for their ODI return against South Africa. A light-hearted moment between Kohli and Rishabh Pant highlighted Kohli's form. Both batsmen are nearing significant international milestones: Rohit is close to 20,000 runs, while Kohli could surpass Sachin Tendulkar's century record in a single format.
title: 'Tagda maar diya': Virat Kohli’s explosive shot leaves Pant speechless - Watch

author: SRISHTI LAKHOTIA
description: A Kolkata businessman, aged over 90, passed away at a hospital on Saturday. This occurred as the Calcutta High Court heard a plea from his daughter seeking to visit him. The daughter, residing in Mumbai, had been denied access to her father. The court was informed of the businessman's death via live video by his wife.
title: Kolkata: 90-year-old father dies in hospital as HC hears daughter’s plea for last meeting

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Trade 'white people' for 'chicken tikka masala': Piers Morgan shuts down 'racist' claims

author: SAT SINGH
description: A 26-year-old Rohtak bodybuilder, Rohit Dhankhar, tragically died after confronting men harassing women at a wedding in Bhiwani. Ambushed by approximately 20 assailants armed with weapons, Rohit was brutally beaten when he and his friend stopped at a railway crossing. Despite efforts by doctors, he succumbed to his severe injuries.
title: Bhiwani wedding: Bodybuilder dies after attack for confronting men harassing women

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Billionaire Mark Cuban confessed to running a "chain letter" scam in college to fund his education. He admitted to convincing dormmates to invest in a money-making scheme, which he later clarified was a "scam." This early hustle, alongside other ventures like selling trash bags, paved the way for his eventual multi-billion dollar success, including selling Broadcast.com to Yahoo for billions.
title: Billionaire Mark Cuban remembers the 'chain letter' that helped him pay for his college

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Jammu and Kashmir High Court ruled cross-LoC trade as intra-state, asserting Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is part of the Union Territory. The court dismissed petitions from traders challenging GST notices, stating the trade was internal. This ruling comes after the Indian government suspended cross-LoC trade in 2019 due to misuse concerns.
title: PoK part of India, so trade across LoC intra-state: HC

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shaheen Shah Afridi's decisive spell, including a controversial overturned catch and a subsequent wicket, proved pivotal as Pakistan defeated Sri Lanka to clinch the tri-series title on Friday. Afridi's quick double blow in the 19th over triggered a Sri Lankan collapse, setting Pakistan up for a comfortable chase and title victory.
title: Pakistan players mock umpire after taking wicket vs Sri Lanka - watch

author: SUGANDHA JHA
description: IIIT-Delhi is overhauling its evaluation system by allowing AI tools like ChatGPT in exams and assignments. Students will be required to submit their prompts, shifting focus to prompt quality, reasoning, and analysis. This move aims to integrate AI responsibly into education and prepare students for evolving learning patterns.
title: Ask AI, but show your prompts: IIIT-Delhi redefines evaluation
